title: Drawing, "Design for the Decoration of an Oblong Octagonal Ceiling", ca. 1775
medium: Pen and black ink with brush and ink wash on paper
provenance: From the Collection of Lèon Decloux. From the Collection of Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 516 for 160 francs).
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A classical warrior accompanied by two figures is on a bracket in a pavilion in the center. Two satyrs are shown on the bracket.  Circular motifs surround the central motif. Four female figures, possibly Muses, accompanied by putti, are seated at the corners, leaning against spirals. Lambrequins at their feet change into lines and terminate in grotesque masks. The subject may possibly represent Minerva and the Four Virtues.
